author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Assistant Sessions Court here has convicted and awarded eight years imprisonment to a 36-year-old man, who faced trial in an attempt to murder case. Holding that the prosecution has proved the case beyond reasonable doubt, Assistant Sessions Judge S Ganapathisamy awarded the sentence to the accused, A Bakiyam (36), and imposed a fine of Rs. 5,000 on Tuesday. The accused should undergo six more months of imprisonment if he failed to pay the fine, the judge said.

According to prosecution, the case is that Navaneethan of Pamban area was returning home with his wife after attending a church festival on September 4, 2012 when he questioned the accused for washing his car in the middle of the road, causing inconvenience to the road users. After a wordy duel, he stabbed Navaneethan repeatedly in his stomach and hip. The grievously injured, Navaneethan, was under prolonged treatment.
title: 8-year jail term for man
